name: 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane (2s,3s)
Reason: 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane is a compound with a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its functional groups. The basic unit of analysis is the butane moiety, which has a melting point of around -0.5°C. The epoxy groups (–O–CH2–) increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The stereochemistry of the epoxy groups can also affect the melting point, with the (2S,3S) isomer having a slightly higher melting point than the (2R,3R) isomer due to the increased steric hindrance.
